docs.lead_paragraph: Children are being neglected in policies that appeal to their elders — but they are the ones who will have to pay the bills run up today.

headline.main: Cutbacks and the Fate of the Young
headline.print_headline: Cutbacks And the Fate Of the Young

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column charges that children are being neglected in policies that appeal to their elders in the upcoming presidential election, even though future generations will have to foot the bills for those choices; says the nation's growing debt needs to be addressed by a broader debate on how to ensure that the next generation of taxpaying adults has a fair shot at prosperity.
docs.snippet: Children are being neglected in policies that appeal to their elders — but they are the ones who will have to pay the bills run up today.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama and Mitt Romney have profound differences over how to address problems with health insurance coverage and rising health care costs. Most of the major provisions of the Obama health care law will not go into effect until 2014.
docs.snippet: President Obama and Mitt Romney have profound differences over how to address problems with health insurance coverage and rising health care costs. Most of the major provisions of the Obama health care law will not go into effect until 2014.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: PATIENT PROTECTION AND AFFORDABLE CARE ACT (2010)

docs.abstract: A primer on the so-called fiscal cliff, including a breakdown of the tax cuts that could expire and the programs that could be affected.
docs.snippet: A primer on the so-called fiscal cliff, including a breakdown of the tax cuts that could expire and the programs that could be affected.

docs.abstract: A survey of caregivers found that half the respondents were performing medical or nursing tasks, as well as helping with the activities of daily living.
docs.snippet: A survey of caregivers found that half the respondents were performing medical or nursing tasks, as well as helping with the activities of daily living.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Medicare reform, Republicans have the upper hand.
docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column contends Paul Ryan's controversial plan to reform Medicare is actually one of the strongest components of the Romney-Ryan campaign; notes that Ryan's market-driven approach is at least novel, compared to cost-based solutions that have failed in the past.
docs.snippet: On Medicare reform, Republicans have the upper hand.

docs.lead_paragraph: Electronic record systems can make health care more efficient and less expensive, but their potential for mistakes and confusion can be frustrating, costly and even dangerous.

headline.seo: The Ups and Downs of Electronic Medical Records - The Digital Doctor
headline.main: The Ups and Downs of Electronic Medical Records
headline.print_headline: The Ups and Downs of Electronic Medical Records

docs.abstract: Electronic medical record systems can make health care more efficient, cost effective and accessible, but their potential for mistakes and technological glitches can be costly and even dangerous; shift has been strongly promoted by the Obama administration.
docs.snippet: Electronic record systems can make health care more efficient and less expensive, but their potential for mistakes and confusion can be frustrating, costly and even dangerous.

docs.lead_paragraph: More hospitals and medical practices are adopting videoconferencing to treat patients, as Nantucket’s hospital has, finding that in many cases tele-treating can stand in for an office visit.

headline.seo: Nantucket Hospital Uses Telemedicine as Bridge - The Digital Doctor
headline.main: With Telemedicine as Bridge, No Hospital Is an Island
headline.print_headline: With Telemedicine as Bridge, No Hospital Is an Island

docs.abstract: Some hospitals and medical practices are adopting videoconferencing technology as an affordable and effective way for doctors to examine patients without seeing them in person; method is especially useful in remote locations or in medical specialties that face a shortage of physicians.
docs.snippet: More hospitals and medical practices are adopting videoconferencing to treat patients, as Nantucket’s hospital has, finding that in many cases tele-treating can stand in for an office visit.

docs.lead_paragraph: A shift by the Social Security Administration to limit access to its death records is beginning to slow research, such as assessments of hospital safety and efforts to spot consumer fraud.

headline.seo: Social Security Death Record Limits Hamper Researchers
headline.main: Researchers Wring Hands as U.S. Clamps Down on Death Record Access
headline.print_headline: Researchers Wring Hands As U.S. Clamps Down On Death Record Access

docs.abstract: Social Security Administration's shift to limit access to its death records amid concerns about identity theft is hampering a range of research, including federal assessments of hospital safety and efforts by the financial industry to spot consumer fraud; federal agencies with a stake in medical research are lobbying Social Security officials to consider a compromise.
docs.snippet: A shift by the Social Security Administration to limit access to its death records is beginning to slow research, such as assessments of hospital safety and efforts to spot consumer fraud.

headline.main: Apps Alert the Doctor When Trouble Looms
headline.print_headline: Apps That Can Alert the Doctor When Trouble Looms

docs.abstract: New technology uses standard features on smartphones — GPS and movement tracking — to monitor a patient’s behavior and alert the doctor when something seems out of order.
docs.snippet: New technology uses standard features on smartphones — GPS and movement tracking — to monitor a patient’s behavior and alert the doctor when something seems out of order.

headline.main: UnitedHealth to Buy Control of Brazilian Company for $4.9 Billion
headline.print_headline: UnitedHealth to Buy 90% of Brazilian Provider

docs.abstract: With the deal for the health care provider Amil Participações, UnitedHealth is aiming to capitalize on the favorable demographics of Brazil, which is enjoying a strong economy and a growing middle class.
docs.snippet: With the deal for the health care provider Amil Participações, UnitedHealth is aiming to capitalize on the favorable demographics of Brazil, which is enjoying a strong economy and a growing middle class.
